downloadTitle: Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services SDK Setup
downloadDescription: Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services (MABS) is a simple, powerful, and extensible cloud-based integration service that provides Business-to-Business (B2B) and Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) capabilities for delivering cloud and hybrid integration solutions. The service is run on a secure, dedicated per tenant environment that you can provision on demand.
detailsSection:
• Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services SDK Setup
    • Installs the Visual Studio project templates for creating a BizTalk Service project for Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) and BizTalk Service Artifacts for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI). This is also required to create a BizTalk Service project that can include a BizTalk Adapter Service component. The BizTalk Adapter Service (BAS) feature allows an application in the cloud to communicate with a Line-of-Business (LOB) system on-premise, in your network, behind your firewall.
    • Provides the tools to develop and deploy Bridges and Artifacts. Also includes PowerShell cmdlets to manage the BAS Runtime components.
  • Find the Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services Documentation here.
  • Try out the Windows Azure BizTalk Services samples here. 
  • If you need the previous SDK (i.e. November 2013 SDK) fetch it from here.
systemRequirementsSection:
• Account Requirements: Before running the samples you should create one or more instances of Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services. To create a BizTalk Service instance, please click here.
  • The MABS SDK works with Professional, Premium and Ultimate editions of Microsoft Visual Studio 2012.
installInstructionSection:
• To install:
    • On this page, click Download, then click Run.
    • Alternatively, click Save to download the installer file to your computer. Then navigate to the location at which you saved the file, double-click the file, and then follow the wizard instructions.
  • To uninstall/repair:
    • Please use Add/Remove Programs to uninstall or repair the appropriate component.
  • To get started on developing Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services applications:
    • Read the Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services Documentation here.
    • Try out the Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services samples here.
